sen.j: 石作神社・玉作神社（いしつくりじんじゃ・たまつくりじんじゃ）は、滋賀県伊香郡木之本町に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Ishitsukuri-jinja Shrine and Tamatsukuri-jinja Shrine are the shrines that exist in Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
Ishitsukuri-jinja Shrine and Tamatsukuri-jinja Shrine are the shrines located in Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: that existをlocatedに変更しました。
sen.e: Ishitsukuri-jinja Shrine and Tamatsukuri-jinja Shrine are the shrines located in Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
They are Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki Laws).
They are Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki Laws).
They are Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki Laws).
They were prefectural shrines in old classification of shrines.
They were prefectural shrines in old classification of shrines.
They were prefectural shrines in old classification of shrines.

sen.j: 中世以降の度々の戦禍により創祀の年代・由緒は不詳。
sen.e: The history of the shrines are unknown because of the war devastations during and after the medieval period.
The history of the shrines is unknown because of the war devastations during and after the medieval period.
The history of the shrines is unknown because of the war devastations during and after the medieval period.

sen.j: 近隣の水田に「石作」という塚がある。
sen.e: There is a mound called 'Ishitsukuri' in the nearby rice field.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a mound called 'Ishitsukuri' in the nearby rice field.
There is a mound called 'Ishitsukuri' in the nearby rice field.

sen.j: 禁足地となっており、旧社地との伝承がある。
sen.e: The place is Kinsokuchi (tabooed land), and it has been transmitted that it is where the shrines used to be.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The place is Kinsokuchi (tabooed land), and it has been transmitted that it is where the shrines used to be.
The place is Kinsokuchi (tabooed land), and it has been transmitted that it is where the shrines used to be.

sen.j: 明治9年に村社、明治18年に郷社、大正11年には県社に列格した。
sen.e: The shrines were listed as sonsha (village shrine) in 1876, gosha (village shrine) in 1885 and kensha (prefectural shrine) in 1922.
The shrines were listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876, a gosha (a regional shrine) in 1885 and a kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1922.
sen.cmt: 郷社をa regional shrineとしました。
sen.e: The shrines were listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876, a gosha (a regional shrine) in 1885 and a kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1922.
